Pathological Conditions, Signs and Symptoms/Pathologic Processes/Arrhythmias, Cardiac/Tachycardia/Tachycardia, Reciprocating/Tachycardia, Atrioventricular Nodal Reentry
Cardiovascular Diseases/Heart Diseases/Arrhythmias, Cardiac/Tachycardia/Tachycardia, Reciprocating/Tachycardia, Atrioventricular Nodal Reentry
Record.Description: A supraventricular tachycardia due to reentry along a circuit contained within the AV node. AVNRT is the most common form of supraventricular tachycardia and usually presents as a narrow QRS complex tachycardia at a rate between 150 and 250 beats per minute.

Abnormally rapid heartbeats caused by reentry of atrial impulse into the dual (fast and slow) pathways of ATRIOVENTRICULAR NODE. The common type involves a blocked atrial impulse in the slow pathway which reenters the fast pathway in a retrograde direction and simultaneously conducts to the atria and the ventricles leading to rapid HEART RATE of 150-250 beats per minute.
